DISCLOSURE_INFO:
{
  "Allegations" : "ON APRIL 16, 2010, MADISON AVENUE SECURITIES, INC. (\"MAS\") RECEIVED A PHONE CALL FROM [THIRD PARTY], A FORMER CLIENT OF MR. CLARK'S. HE ALLEGED THAT A CHANGE OF BROKER-DEALER / REP OF RECORD HAD BEEN MADE TO HIS PACIFIC LIFE VARIABLE ANNUITY CONTRACT WITHOUT HIS AUTHORIZATION. IN ADDITION, HE STATED THAT A CO-WORKER, [CUSTOMER], HAD SIMILAR ALLEGATIONS AND TO PLEASE CONTACT HER FOR INFORMATION. ON APRIL 19, 2010, [CUSTOMER] WAS CONTACTED BY MAS TO DISCUSS THE ALLEGATIONS. SHE CLAIMED THAT HER SIGNATURE HAD BEEN MISAPPROPRIATED / FORGED. PACIFIC LIFE'S COMPLIANCE DEPARTMENT WAS CONTACTED TO OBTAIN A COPY OF THE CHANGE OF BROKER-DEALER FORM WITH HER SIGNATURE. IN ADDITION, [CUSTOMER] SENT VIA EMAIL A WRITTEN CUSTOMER COMPLAINT TO MAS. IN A FOLLOW UP CONVERSATION, [CUSTOMER] STATED THAT THE SIGNATURE LOOKED AUTHENTIC, BUT THE DATE WAS NOT HER HANDWRITING. [CUSTOMER] DID NOT ALLEGE ANY MONETARY DAMAGES OR LOSS.",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "UPON JOINING MAS, MR. CLARK HAD HIS OFFICE STAFF SEND CHANGE OF BROKER-DEALER FORMS TO ALL OF HIS FORMER PACIFIC LIFE CLIENTS. ONCE THE CLIENT'S RETURNED THE FORMS TO MR. CLARKS OFFICE, STAFF FAXED THE CHANGE OF BROKER-DEALER FORMS TO PACIFIC LIFE. MAS AND PACIFIC LIFE INVESTIGATED THE ALLEGATIONS AND COMPARED THE SIGNATURES OF [THIRD PARTY] AND [CUSTOMER] TO THE SIGNATURES ON THEIR ORIGINAL VARIABLE ANNUITY CONTRACTS WHICH WERE IN PACIFIC LIFE'S POSSESSION. MR. CLARK'S OFFICE DID NOT HAVE COPIES OF THE ORIGINAL DOCUMENTS ON FILE AND IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO ABILITY FOR HIM OR ONE OF HIS OFFICE STAFF TO FORGE OR MISAPPROPRIATE THE SIGNATURES. IN ADDITION, DURING A VERBAL CONVERSATION WITH MAS, [CUSTOMER] STATED THAT HER SIGNATURE LOOKED AUTHENTIC, BUT SHE WOULD NOT HAVE SIGNED THE FORM ON A SUNDAY. BOTH PACIFIC LIFE'S COMPLIANCE DEPARTMENT AND MAS' COMPLIANCE DEPARTMENT REVIEWED THE CLIENT'S SIGNATURE AND DETERMINED THAT THE SIGNATURE LOOKED LEGITIMATE, HOWEVER THAT MR. CLARK'S OFFICE STAFF HAD POSSIBLY PRE-POPULATED THE DATES ON THE FORMS NEXT TO THE SIGNATURES. PACIFIC LIFE REVERSED THE CHANGE OF BROKER-DEALER / REP OF RECORD BACK TO [THIRD PARTY] AND [CUSTOMER'S] SPECIFICATIONS. MAS DETERMINED THAT THE ALLEGATION OF FORGERY WAS WITHOUT MERIT AND CLOSED THE MATTER. ON MAY 18, 2010, PACIFIC LIFE TERMINATED MR. CLARK'S VARIABLE ONLY CONTRACT WITHOUT CAUSE."
}
